shipTipAlert.title: {Ship Tip: Did you know you can reduce cost by using certain materials?}

dimWeightAlert.title: Ship Tip: What is dimensional weight?
dimWeightAlert.text:
Packages are priced either by weight or dimensional weight--a calculation based on package size.

Multiply the length, width, and height of your package in {centimeters}, and divide that number by {5,000} to find the dimensional weight in {kilograms}.

The larger number determines your shipping charges, so if you have a lightweight item packed in an oversize container, you may want to consider using a smaller box.

referenceTip.title: Ship Tip:
referenceTip.text: A reference number is any combination of numbers and letters you can use to track and identify your shipment. You can use a purchase order number, customer name, or phrase like "10 crates" or "gift for Mom."

lithiumBatteriesTip.title: Ship Tip: Some options for shipping lithium batteries are limited by your shipping route.
lithiumBatteriesTip.text:
Transport to your destination requires some air flight. In certain circumstances, if lithium batteries are not properly packed there is a risk of electrical discharge or overheating due to air pressure changes in flight. Your options for shipping lithium batteries are limited as a result.

More options for shipping regulated items like batteries are available with a UPS dangerous goods contract. You will also need a lithium metal battery shipper pre-approval agreement.

Shipping Batteries or Devices with Batteries This will open in a new window

lithiumBatteriesTip2.title: Ship Tip: no more than one section II per consignee.

lithiumBatteryOptionsLever.help_btn: Lithium batteries are high capacity power cells used in electronic devices, tools, and some games and toys. Generally, lithium ion batteries are rechargeable and lithium metal batteries are not.
lithiumBatteryOptionsLever.helper_txt: All lithium ion or metal batteries

dimWeightAlert.title: Ship Tip: What is dimensional weight?
dimWeightAlert.text:
Packages are priced either by weight or dimensional weight--a calculation based on package size.

Multiply the length, width, and height of your package in {centimeters}, and divide that number by {5,000} to find the dimensional weight in {kilograms}.

The larger number determines your shipping charges, so if you have a lightweight item packed in an oversize container, you may want to consider using a smaller box.

referenceTip.title: Ship Tip:
referenceTip.text: A reference number is any combination of numbers and letters you can use to track and identify your shipment. You can use a purchase order number, customer name, or phrase like "10 crates" or "gift for Mom."

lithiumBatteriesTip.title: Ship Tip: Some options for shipping lithium batteries are limited by your shipping route.
lithiumBatteriesTip.text:
Transport to your destination requires some air flight. In certain circumstances, if lithium batteries are not properly packed there is a risk of electrical discharge or overheating due to air pressure changes in flight. Your options for shipping lithium batteries are limited as a result.

More options for shipping regulated items like batteries are available with a UPS dangerous goods contract. You will also need a lithium metal battery shipper pre-approval agreement.

Shipping Batteries or Devices with Batteries This will open in a new window

lithiumBatteriesTip2.title: Ship Tip: no more than one section II per consignee.

error_CODAmtCollect.errorMessage: Amount to Collect field is required.

pkgHelpOver150.text: Packages over {150 lbs.} or more on a pallet typically classify as Freight.

pkgHelpDefault.text: Providing weight and dimensions will give you a more accurate rate.

pkgHelpUnpackaged.text: Please tape corrugated cardboard pieces to all sharp or protruding edges for protection. Cover the other surfaces of the item as needed.

pkgHelpFreight.text:
Freight packages are typically {150 lbs.} or more and ship on a pallet or skid.

Review the Wood Packaging Guidelines to avoid any holds or delays.

pkgHelpRawWoodPallet.text:
Review the Wood Packaging Guidelines to avoid any holds or delays.

For pallets, the value entered for Length must be greater than or equal to the Width value.
